page.title: 19Rowberrow Forest.
page.content: This was the Royal Mendip Forest. The Mendip Hunt & the Weston Harriers ride from their kennels to chase fox where Kings once hunted for deer,wolf and wild boar.Lady Catherine Rowan is the owner.The trees growing there now are: Douglas Fir,Sitka Spruce,Western Hemlock,Western Red Cedar,Scots Pine and Corsican Pine.After 40 - 50 years they are felled & used to make paper, floors,chairs,tables and plywood.Cedar wood is used for quality pencils, outside houses and garden sheds.In the forest you are allowed to horse ride or walk on the public rights of way.You need permission to do anything else.There are about 80 Roe Deer and they are a menace because they rub their antlers on the trees and this kills the trees. Badgers,Squirrels, Foxes and Rabbits live there now.
